required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Safety and Tolerability of Lu AE58054 as Adjunctive Treatment to Donepezil in Patients With Mild-moderate Alzheimer's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Tolerability of Lu AE58054 as Adjunctive Treatment to Donepezil in Patients With Mild-moderate Alzheimer's Disease

oversight_info.authority: Czech Republic: State Institute for Drug Control
United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the long-term safety and tolerability of Lu AE58054 as adjunctive therapy to donepezil in patients with mild-moderate AD.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Change in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale-cognitive subscale (ADAS-Cog) total score
Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study - Clinical Global Impression of Change (ADCS-CGIC) score
Change in Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study - Activities of Daily Living Inventory (ADCS-ADL23) total score
Change in Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI) total score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cognitive aspects of mental function
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE)

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk of Suicidality Using C-SSRS Scores

arm_group.description: Lu AE58054 adjunct to 10 mg Donepezil. The dose to be maintained throughout the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient has completed Visit 7 (Completion Visit) in the lead-in double-blind, placebo controlled clinical studies 14861A/NCT01955161 or 14862A/NCT02006641.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patient has a moderate or severe ongoing adverse event from the lead-in study considered a potential safety risk by the investigator.
- The patient has experienced seizures before Completion Visit in the lead-in study.
- The patient has evidence of clinically significant disease.
- The patient's donepezil treatment is likely to be interrupted or discontinued during the study.
- The patient is receiving therapy with another acetylcholinesterase inhibitors (AChEI) or memantine.
Other protocol-defined inclusion and exclusion criteria may apply.

overall_official.last_name: Email contact via H. Lundbeck A/S
